There is only one RSS 2.0 spec. The first page on a Google search doesn't even point to it. https://t.co/hgikElJfE2
This is symbolic of what happened with RSS.
RSS was brought together by a (very) small tech company and the #1 news org.
I've always felt users could drive the tech. This was an incredible example of that working.
A Google search for "Defund Fox News." Lots of hits. No one should be forced to fund Putin's propaganda arm in the US. https://t.co/m6zpJTQbUb

A question for devs. When connecting a web client to a server, do you do polling, long polling or websockets for real time updates? Do you know what Twitter does? Facebook? Any other popular "live" web app.
Sarah Sherman is a star. Maybe as big as Gilda Radner. https://t.co/l997LibvGl
FeedWordPress is an open-source RSS aggregator for the WordPress blog publishing platform. https://t.co/URgxgG6UNB
Defund Fox News. https://t.co/wkRi4RaMnX

Paolo has been blogging for 20 years. https://t.co/Z7DS0ANg4v

We're still under Putin's thumb. That's the uneasy feeling that somehow the discussion is missing the big picture. Putin's PR in the US is Fox News. The only mystery is what the deal is, who's paying whom. Murdoch and Putin, they're in charge. Until we fight back.
Do people who write the news understand this? â¬†ï¸Ž

1/7 I watched King Richard over the weekend, so it's fresh in my mind.
2/7 There's a scene where Smith and his daughters are on a tennis court in Compton, all of his daughters, not just Venus and Serena. There are a bunch of asshole teenage boys nearby who are hassling one of his daughters who's trying to study.
3/7 After they're done practicing, Smith confronts the boys. They beat him up. He does nothing to respond, he just takes it (like Chris Rock last night).
4/7 Later in the movie he's bullied by an agent and his response is to fart out loud at him (which I like, it's aggressive but nonviolent). The agent definitely had it coming.
5/7 Later, the character tells Venus a story about him getting beat up as a kid, and his father was nearby and did nothing to help him.
6/7 The speech Smith gave in accepting his award could have been the speech the character in the movie would have made. About protecting people.
7/7 No conclusions, it's just odd how closely the events last night track the ones in the movie, but opposite. What the character did is hard. The character did it right. The actor was confused, life is not a movie, and he got it wrong.
@nakedjen good point!
Heh. Maybe we don't need to raise interest rates so much. ;-) https://t.co/C7JREAA5zB
It's okay to be angry, it's definitely not okay to act out that anger on other people's bodies.
